messageBody:
Hello Ted

Thanks for taking the time to make this detailed response. It was very useful to be able to review the key points in the discussion.

I have been following the discussion with interest and have read all the posts on all three sites for the past 3 or 4 months.  My main concerns are these:

1. That we have a "standardised" assignment of letters so that it does not matter whether we have your font or Paul's or Joe Blogg's font whatever is published is displayed correctly on everybody's computer.

2. The keyboard assignments are "logical".  Some of the choices that appear to be made in QS-SAMPA do not appear to me to be logical.  This is why I posted my last comments.

3. We establish, quickly, a standard font set that we can use to include in posts to the groups.  At the moment if I include {  } in my message, I dont know if anyone can read it. On that point, if everyone used Anthony Grahn's excellent ThothUni typing tool then we can all represent QS letters in our posts. This will make them a lot more readable.

I have been through the QS Sampa keyboard proposal in detail and while I can see the point of some of the choices there are others which puzzle me. For example, why swap If and Eat between "i" and "I". It makes little logical sense to me. Neither does taking away Exam from the "x" key. Also,  and  being on the "q" key makes them easy to remember.  I know one can go on forever playing with these keyboard assignments but I guess at the end of the day one can learn anything.  Does anyone else have any comments on this proposed layout?



On 08/12/2007, Ted Larson Freeman < freeman@...> wrote:

Hi Moira,

Some of your questions have to do with QS-SAMPA, and some have to do
with the ThothSampa font, which does not yet include everything in the
QS-SAMPA proposal and which contains remnants of the earlier layout.
(For a font that does conform to QS-SAMPA, I suggest you try the font
"Junior Sampa no. 1", contained in the file "JuniorQSSAMPA1.ttf" in
the "Files->Fonts" folder for this group.)

First, a few comments about QS-SAMPA. I'm not sure if you've read the
previous thread of messages about the proposal--if not I encourage you
to review them--and the files in the "Files->QS-SAMPA" folder. I'd
especially point out the file "qs_sampa.pdf", which lists the Jerome
and QS-SAMPA key assignments in the fourth and fifth columns. One of
the main reasons I made this proposal is that I'd like to make QS as
accessible as possible to professional linguists. This will be easier
if we move toward a standard notation that linguists already use.
Because we rely on the internet, it's also important to use ASCII
characters (just 7-bit ASCII, the first 128 characters). Further, I
wanted to use only upper and lower case letters to represent QS
letters so that punctuation marks and special symbols would be
available while typing QS.

Wikipedia has good articles on SAMPA and X-SAMPA:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X-SAMPA
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SAMPA_chart_for_English

John Cowan provided the core of the proposal by going through X-SAMPA
and suggesting changes whenever X-SAMPA uses two letters for a QS
letter, or X-SAMPA assigns a non-letter (e.g. "@" or "{"), or QS
represents two sounds with one letter (QS #43 and #44). He explained
the differences from X-SAMPA in his message:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/message/1538

To round out the proposal, I added the assignments for the alternate
letters 'Noon' and 'Up' and for the naming dot and angled brackets.
(There has been some recent discussion about the naming dot, but for
now it's assigned to the backquote.) Six capital letters remain
unassigned.

I agree that it will take some practice to get used to the new
assignments. We'll need to adopt a few new memory aids. For example,
you'll notice that the Spanish vowels "a, e, i, o, u" would be
represented in QS-SAMPA the letters by "A, e, i, o, u". (It's not
perfect, but it helped me.) And if you truly hate it, my offer stands
to create a customized keyboard layout for you.

Ted

> This is the QS-SAMPA current keyboard layout - not sure how it is going to
> display on the web, but hopefully it will look OK if you have ThothSampa
> font installed.
>
> I have a few issues on this layout. I would like to see more logical
> assignments for eg:
>
> 1. {Q} which for me should be on the 'O' key
> 2. {K} which logically should be on the 'K' key
> 3. Oil appears to be a duplicated on 'q' and 'R'
> 4. 'i' and 'I' have been swapped from Jerome. IMHO Jerome is more logical.
> 5. I can't see the namer dot in this keyboard.
>
> I am aware that I can design my own keyboard layout, but that is not as
> satisfactory in my opinion as arriving at more logical assignments.
>
> I find 12pt to be difficult to read though I can't fault your sizing
> compared to TO. The above is 16pt and is at a size that I find comfortable
> (and its not just because of my age lol).
>
> regards
